definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: Altogether, there are 538 electoral votes (including three for the District of Columbia, even though it has no voting representatives in Congress).
When the nation began, the legislatures mostly named electors directly.
sentences.chinese: 在建国之初，议会通常直接指定选举人。

sentences.english: It set new rules for counting the electoral votes of the states.
sentences.chinese: 它为计数各州选举人票的新规则。

sentences.english: The presidential race is decided by a state-by-state tally of electoral votes.
sentences.chinese: 总统竞选按各州选举人票的票数决定。

sentences.english: The Electoral College Plan itself was the compromise of various interests at the constitutional convention in 1787.
sentences.chinese: 总统选举人团方案本身就是各种利益妥协的结果。

sentences.english: The states Mr. Trump won held 306 electoral votes.
sentences.chinese: 特朗普拿下的各州则持有306张选举人票。

sentences.english: Independent voters are having second thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 独立选举人正在另作考虑。

sentences.english: Voters are telling  the Congress to shove its new tax plan.
sentences.chinese: 选举人让国会把新税法报废。

sentences.english: The lists of candidates shall be submitted to the Party organizations and voters for full deliberation and discussion.
sentences.chinese: 候选人名单要由党组织和选举人充分酝酿讨论。

sentences.english: Only one Republican elector has publicly said he will not vote for Trump.
sentences.chinese: 只有一位选举人公开表示不会投票给川普。

definition: seat in a parliament or legislative assembly
member of the US House of Representatives
